markdown.headingText: Access to Compute and Storage Resources
markdown.markdown:
This page provides an overview of how to apply for compute and storage resources through NAISS/SUPR, what systems are available, how to manage your allocation, and where to get support. ## How to Apply
Step 1: Apply for a NAISS/SUPR Account Step 2: Apply for Resources via \"SLU Local 2025\" Step 3: Access After Approval
## Available Systems The following systems can be requested: - **Gorilla** - **Pelle** - **Lutra** **[MORE INFO NEEDED: Add optional system descriptions]** ## Termination of Allocations Allocations must be terminated or renewed when no longer needed. The exact procedure remains **[MORE INFO NEEDED]**. Questions pending confirmation: - Is termination handled through SUPR? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Is a one‑month notice period required? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Should users notify NAISS, SLU IT, or both? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** ## Pricing Billing follows the NAISS/Uppmax pricing model. Current fees: ### Example Costs for Typical Sequencing Projects Examples will be added when representative project types are selected. **[MORE INFO NEEDED: Provide example project types for cost illustrations]** ## Payment Process The payment process is currently **[MORE INFO NEEDED]**. Points to clarify: - Who issues the invoice? NAISS/Uppmax or internal SLU? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Where does the researcher enter a project number or cost center? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Is internal SLU invoicing used? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** ## Support For questions about accounts, applications, or technical issues, contact: **itsupport@slu.se**

# Access to Compute and Storage Resources This page provides an overview of how to apply for compute and storage resources through NAISS/SUPR, what systems are available, how to manage your allocation, and where to get support. ## How to Apply
Step 1: Apply for a NAISS/SUPR Account Step 2: Apply for Resources via \"SLU Local 2025\" Step 3: Access After Approval
## Available Systems The following systems can be requested: - **Gorilla** - **Pelle** - **Lutra** **[MORE INFO NEEDED: Add optional system descriptions]** ## Termination of Allocations Allocations must be terminated or renewed when no longer needed. The exact procedure remains **[MORE INFO NEEDED]**. Questions pending confirmation: - Is termination handled through SUPR? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Is a one‑month notice period required? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Should users notify NAISS, SLU IT, or both? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** ## Pricing Billing follows the NAISS/Uppmax pricing model. Current fees: ### Example Costs for Typical Sequencing Projects Examples will be added when representative project types are selected. **[MORE INFO NEEDED: Provide example project types for cost illustrations]** ## Payment Process The payment process is currently **[MORE INFO NEEDED]**. Points to clarify: - Who issues the invoice? NAISS/Uppmax or internal SLU? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Where does the researcher enter a project number or cost center? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** - Is internal SLU invoicing used? **[MORE INFO NEEDED]** ## Support For questions about accounts, applications, or technical issues, contact: **itsupport@slu.se**
